edu.umass.cs.msocket.common.policies

Class ProxySelectionPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umass.cs.msocket.common.policies.ProxySelectionPolicy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FixedProxyPolicy, GeoLoadProxyPolicy, GeolocationProxyPolicy, NoProxyPolicy, RandomProxyPolicy

    public abstract class ProxySelectionPolicy
extends Object
implements Serializable
    This class defines options to specify the user preference when choosing a proxy.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Emmanuel Cecchet
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • ProxySelectionPolicy

        public ProxySelectionPolicy()

    • Method Detail

      • getProxyAddresses

        public List<InetSocketAddress> getProxyAddresses()
        Ordered list of Proxy addresses according to the current policy
        Returns:
        List of InetSocketAddress or null if no proxy has been found

      • getNewProxy

        public abstract List<InetSocketAddress> getNewProxy()
                                             throws Exception
        Get a list of IPs for proxies in a proxy group according to the current proxy selection policy. This method is called by MServerSocket.
        Returns:
        list of proxy IP addresses (eventually empty)
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs while getting the new proxy

      • hasAvailableProxies

        public abstract boolean hasAvailableProxies()
        Returns true if the policy can find available proxies
        Returns:
        true if proxies are currently available through this policy

      • getProxyIPs

        public abstract List<String> getProxyIPs(List<ProxyStatusInfo> proxies,
                                         Socket acceptedSocket)
        Server side implementation of the policy. Return the IPs of the selected proxies based upon the policy. This is called by the location service.
        Parameters:
        proxies - the current status of active proxies in the system
        acceptedSocket - client socket that was accepted by the location service
        Returns:
        ordered list of IP:port of proxies selected by the policy
